text: Gilbert Ronald Larrieu (May 23, 1937 - June 1, 2020), known as Ron Larrieu, was an American long-distance runner. He competed in the men's 10,000 metres at the 1964 Summer Olympics. He was born in San Francisco. He was a two time national champion in cross country, in 1965 and 1966. Larrieu died on June 1, 2020 at the age of 83. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:1937 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American long-distance runners Category:Sportspeople from San Francisco
title: Ron Larrieu
